intro: Saxifraga nelsoniana subsp. insularis, commonly known as the island saxifrage, is a perennial herb native to the Galápagos Islands. It is characterized by its rosette growth form and produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique evolutionary traits and limited distribution.
